etymology.description: Pictogram: a cloud with drops of rain; the top horizontal stroke was added later.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a rain cloud shedding droplets, making the meaning immediately transparent. In its regular-script form, the four dots suggest raindrops, while the added top stroke stabilizes and balances the overall shape.

examples.chinese: 今天下雨了(今天下雨了。)
雨停了(雨停了)，地上还是湿的(地上還是濕的。)
examples.pinyin: Yǔ tíng le, dìshang háishi shī de.
examples.english: The rain has stopped, but the ground is still wet.

examples.chinese: 明天有大雨(明天有大雨)，记得带伞(記得帶傘。)
examples.pinyin: Míngtiān yǒu dàyǔ, jìde dài sǎn.
examples.english: There will be heavy rain tomorrow; remember to bring an umbrella.
